readme.go_wiki: Here is more detailed user manual
readme.localization: Nice localization with support of dozens of languages:
readme.run_os: Runs on Linux, Windows, MacOS, and more...
readme.title: Coctohug - Manage dozens of chia blockchain forks  mining from a web browser!
readme.trademark_detail: CHIA NETWORK INC, CHIA™, the CHIA BLOCKCHAIN™, the CHIA PROTOCOL™, CHIALISP™ and the “leaf Logo” (including the leaf logo alone when it refers to or indicates Chia), are trademarks or registered trademarks of Chia Network, Inc., a Delaware corporation. *There is no affliation between this Coctohug project and the main Chia Network project.*
wiki.browser_access_url: Open browser and access WebUI with url
wiki.check_fews_days: Check coctohug github every fews days
wiki.choose_language: On top right of WebUI, choose whatever language you like most
wiki.click_allow_harvester: and click Allow Harvester to build the link between controller and harvester
wiki.confirm_cold_address: Confirm each address is correct manually by comparing the downloaded file with information shown on Keys tab
wiki.connect_blockchain: You may go to Connections or Blockchains tab to examine the detailed status
wiki.cpu_requirement: Once synchronized, 10th Generation Intel® Core™ i7 Processors should be enough for farming 50+ blockchain forks
wiki.cpu_requirement_note: However for the intial node syncing stage, it really eats CPU. So we recommend setup 5 blockchain forks per group, and start group by group
wiki.decrypt_with_password: You can decrypt it with the password when adding new blockchain forks
wiki.disk_requirement: Normal disk should be fine for 50+ blockchain forks
wiki.edit_connection: You can add/remove connections in Connections tab
wiki.encrypt_your_keys: It encrypt your keys with a password only you know
wiki.enter_form_fields: then enter all the necessary form fields and download the generated zipped docker-compose files
wiki.examine_other: You can also examine detail using other tabs
wiki.execute_by_step: You can also execute above scripts step by step
wiki.fast_provide: provides nodes list and database file(click each blockchain and then you can find them on top right section)
wiki.few_minutes_harvester: Few minutes later, you will be able to see harvester on WebUI hands tab
wiki.fork_panel_background: each blockchain fork-panel in Summary tab will have a light green background if it is working fine, otherwise it will be light yellow background
wiki.fork_worker: This is each blockchain fork workers
wiki.generate_new_key: On WebUI launch screen, generate a new key this time
wiki.get_24_mnemonic_words: Get 24 mnemonic words by similar terminal script
wiki.go_each_folder: Go to each folder and execute script
wiki.harvester_generate_compose: and click Harvester Mode to generate docker-compose folders
wiki.import_backup: Note 1: we recommend backup your wallet configurations before importing
wiki.import_note_2: Note 2: Only working blockchain forks can import cold wallet. Please check whether there are stopped blockchain forks or not before doing this. Surely you can also import later again when they are re-started
wiki.import_json: Import the previous downloaded cold wallet(recommended on different machine) json file
wiki.import_machine: On your mining machine, visit settings - cold wallet tab
wiki.import_wait: Wait few minutes, and go to wallet tab to see whether the cold wallet address is updated or not
wiki.incompatible_db_issue: In case of incompatible db issue, you can remove the existing database file before executing docker-compose start script by
wiki.list_plot_count: List possible plot count decreasing issue
wiki.list_wallet: List wallet status and account balance
wiki.monitor_farming: Then you will be able to monitor the mining status with various ways
wiki.new_forks_will_supported: New blockchain forks will be supported very soon
wiki.no_more_5_forks: Note 1: Do not start up more than 5 blockchain forks at the same time, since chia blockchain forks  really eat CPU when node syncing for the first time
wiki.node_sync_default: Node will sync automatically by default
wiki.node_sync_done: Once node sync is done, farming should start automatically
wiki.or_generate_new_key: Or you can generate one totally new key - this is mainly for cold wallet purpose
wiki.prepare_new_machine: Prepare a new machine(different with mining machine)
wiki.prompt_24_words: You will be prompt to enter the 24 mnemonic words, when you first time access WebUI with url - this is mainly for farming purpose
wiki.prompt_password: You will be prompt to set a password for secure settings, when you first time access WebUI with url
wiki.ram_required: Note 2: Around 1.8G RAM is required for each blockchain fork, so choose some blockchain forks based on you computer memory
wiki.ram_requirement: Memory needed equals to: number of mining blockchain forks multiply 1.8G RAM
wiki.received_coins_link: Received Coins tab has a link:
wiki.remaining_same: Remaining steps are same with above
wiki.remove_hand: You may remove one hand when you don't plan to farm it anymore
wiki.rull_all_folders: Run all the folders by order:
wiki.secure_include: Secure settings include: Cold Wallet, Coin Transfer, Restart Blockchain Forks, Harvester...
wiki.setting_password: Go to settings tab with your secure password
wiki.setting_password_transfer: Go to wallet tab and enter your secure password to transfer coins
wiki.settings_export_cold: and go to settings - cold wallet tab to export the cold wallet addresses
wiki.settings_import_cold: and go to settings - cold wallet tab to import the cold wallet addresses
wiki.summarize_block_day: Summarize Blocks Found / Coins Received by day
wiki.summarize_block_week: Summarize Blocks Found / Coins Received by week
wiki.summary_show: Summary tab can show: Total Mined Coins, Account Balance, Plot Count, Plot Size, Netspace Size and Expected Time to Win
wiki.switch_language_later: You can switch to any other languages later if you wish
wiki.transfer_coin: You can also transfer coins in wallet tab
wiki.ubuntu_wsl: Install Ubuntu or other Linux system using WSL
wiki.unzip_docker_compose: Unzip the downloaded folders and copy them into your working directory
wiki.used_secure_24: can be used to secure your 24 mnemonic words
wiki.wait_few_minutes: Wait few minutes for blockchain forks restarting
wiki.wallet_mode_generate: and click Wallet Mode to generate docker-compose folders
wiki.re_script: Note 3: If there are any issues, you may need rerun all the folders by order:
wiki.firewall_port: Note 4: You may need to add allowing ports from 12630 to 12700 on your system firewall settings
